Stochastic Performance Logic (SPL) evaluation engine

Evaluation engine of Performance Stochastic Logic for Java.

Evaluation engine of Performance Stochastic Logic for Java.

Introduction

Stochastice Performance Logic is a formalism for capturing performance assumptions. It is, for example, possible to capture assumption that newer version of a function bar is faster than the previous version or that library foobar is faster than library barfoo when rendering antialiased text.

The purpose of this framework is to allow evaluation of SPL formulas inside Java applications.

More information about SPL is available at http://d3s.mff.cuni.cz/software/spl.

Usage

The framework expects that the user has the actual data ready and only wants to evaluate them inside SPL. Thus, the framework offers two concepts only: data sources (cz.cuni.mff.d3s.spl.DataSource interface) and formulas (cz.cuni.mff.d3s.spl.Formula interface).

Data sources

Data sources that represent input data fed into SPL formulas. Typically, these input data are derived from method execution times but they can also represent system load or last level cache misses.

Formulas requires the cz.cuni.mff.d3s.spl.DataSource interface that is implemented for example by a RingDataSource that provides a ring-buffer structure for storing individual samples.

Formulas

Formulas are the heart of the framework. They use the Stochastic Performance Logic to express assumptions/questions about application performance. They are represented by the cz.cuni.mff.d3s.spl.Formula interface.

Although one can use implementation from cz.cuni.mff.d3s.spl.formula to build the formula, it is easier to express the formula as a string and parse it with SplFormula.create(java.lang.String).

Individual variables in the formula must always be binded to concrete data sources prior formula evaluation. This allows you to reuse to formula with different data sources (e.g. modeled performance vs. actually measured performance). Different interpretation of the formula can be used as well (see cz.cuni.mff.d3s.spl.Interpretation).
